info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 01 at 7:10PM PDT until August 01 at 9:45PM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM PDT THIS EVENING FOR CENTRAL CLARK COUNTY... At 710 PM PDT, Heavy rain persists in the northern Las Vegas Valley with over an inch of rain having fallen near Lone Mountain. Local washes will continue to run high and flash flooding remains a danger. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Las Vegas, North Las Vegas, Lone Mountain, Summerlin, Centennial Hills, Spring Valley, North Las Vegas Airport and The Lakes. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
